sentence.Network_en: I stayed obstinately in my room, sitting by the telephone.
sentence.Network_cn: 我执意呆在房间里，坐在电话机旁边。

sentence.Network_en: Smith obstinately refused to carry out the order.
sentence.Network_cn: 史密斯我行我素，拒不执行命令。

sentence.Network_en: He obstinately asserted that he had done the right thing.

entry.def: If you describe someone as obstinate, you are being critical of them because they are very determined to do what they want, and refuse to change their mind or be persuaded to do something else.

example.ex: He is obstinate and determined and will not give up...
example.tran: 他非常顽固，而且又铁了心，是不会放弃的。

example.ex: She was a wicked and obstinate child.
example.tran: 她是个淘气又执拗的孩子。

entry.tran: 难以移动的；难以改变的；难以消除的
entry.def: You can describe things as obstinate when they are difficult to move, change, or destroy.

example.ex: ...rusted farm equipment strewn among the obstinate weeds.
example.tran: 扔在恣意蔓生的杂草丛中的锈迹斑斑的农具

sentences.sentence: "she remained stubbornly in the same position"

auth_sentence.content: Jamie stood obstinately, not moving either way on the path.
auth_sentence.res_content: Jamie stood obstinately, not moving either way on the path.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Jamie stood obstinately, not moving either way on the path.

auth_sentence.content: Farms lie scattered across the carrs, which still obstinately flood in some winters.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Farms lie scattered across the carrs, which still obstinately flood in some winters.

auth_sentence.content: She added to that an unpopular poll tax, which she clung to obstinately when her MPs knew it was putting their seats in peril.

sentences.en: Unemployment figures are remaining obstinately high.
sentences.cn: 失业数字仍然顽固地居高不下。
